H0.text: Pressure at which the processes occurred is the difference in quartz formation that results in the various colors of naturally formed quartz.

H1.text: Temperature at which the processes occurred is the difference in quartz formation that results in the different colors of naturally forming quartz.

H2.text: Chemical impurities present as the processes occurred are the difference in quartz formation that results in the different colors of naturally formed quartz.

H3.text: The amount of time passed since the processes occurred is the difference in quartz formation that results in its various natural colors.

A4.text: These color differentiations arise from the presence of impurities which change the molecular orbitals, causing some electronic transitions to take place in the visible spectrum, emitting colored light.
